situation_1_desc: 727,513 students were enrolled in primary education in 2021/2022.
situation_2_desc: Significant lack in the number and quality of teachers in classrooms.
situation_3_desc: 29% of girls and 35% of boys do not complete primary school.
situation_4_desc: 47% of rural schools offer classes where multiple grades are combined.
situation_5_desc: The absenteeism rate reaches 29% in public schools.
situation_6_desc: In mathematics, only 19% of public school students achieve 50% or more of the overall score, compared to 48% in private schools.
situation_7_desc: Schools lack adequate infrastructure, equipment, and financial means.
situation_8_desc: Low academic performance leads to limited access to employment and encourages high youth emigration.

about_page_content: Teach for Mauritania (TFM) is a national, independent, and non-profit organization founded with the mission of ensuring that every child in Mauritania has access to quality education, regardless of their socio-economic situation. We firmly believe that education is the fundamental pillar of human, social, and economic development, and that investing in today's children's learning builds a better future for society as a whole. TFM is committed to addressing the gaps in the Mauritanian education system by recruiting passionate and talented graduates from various fields. These young professionals are trained and supported to become leaders and teachers capable of transforming classrooms and inspiring positive change in the most vulnerable communities. Our program is based on an innovative approach that combines quality pedagogy, community leadership, and social engagement. Participants undergo rigorous training that enables them not only to develop strong teaching skills but also to become agents of change. They work in the most disadvantaged schools and communities, where their impact is most needed. Beyond teaching, TFM aims to strengthen community capacities by fostering collaboration between teachers, parents, and local leaders. We believe that every child deserves not only an education but also an environment where they can thrive, develop their potential, and dream big.
fellowship_p_1: This program is aimed at motivated graduates and professionals from diverse academic backgrounds. The eligibility criteria are as follows:
fellowship_li_1: Be Mauritanian and aged between 19 and 45 at the time of application.
fellowship_li_2: Hold a university degree with a minimum of xx.
fellowship_li_3: Must have at least 5 O'Level credits in mathematics and English.
fellowship_p_2: Our selection model is designed to identify graduates and young professionals who have the potential to become transformative leaders in the classroom, school, and community.
fellowship_p_3: We are looking for candidates who demonstrate the following characteristics:
fellowship_li_4: Believe in the potential of all children
fellowship_li_5: Believe in equitable and quality education for all children
fellowship_li_6: Have strong academic, personal, and/or professional achievements
fellowship_li_7: Demonstrate leadership potential in various contexts
fellowship_li_8: Perseverance in the face of challenges
fellowship_li_9: Ability to adapt to changing environments
fellowship_li_10: Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to motivate others
fellowship_li_11: Respect and empathy for individuals' diverse experiences
fellowship_li_12: Professional etiquette and good time management
fellowship_engagement_li_1: I am able to participate in the 8-week Summer Institute.
fellowship_engagement_li_2: I am willing to commit to two years as a full-time teacher in a public school in Mauritania, in accordance with the academic calendar of the Ministry of National Education and Reform.
fellowship_engagement_li_3: I am able to attend all required training and development activities during the Leadership Journey in accordance with the academic calendar of the Ministry of National Education and Reform.
fellowship_p_4: At Teach For Mauritania, we strive to provide alternative solutions to the challenges faced by Mauritanian children, offering individuals with no prior teaching experience a unique opportunity to serve society.
fellowship_p_5: To be admitted, candidates must successfully complete the following steps:
program_desc_1: Teach For Mauritania recruits the best university graduates and young professionals for a two-year mission, aiming to teach and have a lasting impact on the success and future of children.
program_desc_2: We offer participants rigorous training and personal and professional development. The training begins with an intensive eight-week course led by experienced trainers and continues with ongoing support for Fellows throughout their two-year commitment with the organization.
program_desc_3: After successfully completing your training at the Summer Institute, teachers are deployed to assigned schools based on vacancies, to teach in primary schools for a two-year paid teaching program. They will also participate in training throughout their two years of teaching.
program_desc_4: Teach For Mauritania provides participants with various forms of support at every stage of their journey. They will be regularly visited by their program manager, who will guide them in developing their teaching and empower them to have the greatest possible impact in their classroom.
program_desc_5: After the Fellowship, all our participants have access to our alumni movement. This community allows people to learn and act together for educational equity.
program_desc_6: Ongoing monitoring and development are in place to ensure the success of all Fellows during their two years in the schools and communities where they are assigned. As well as evaluating the success of children in each TFM partner school.
